title: Wireless Communication Beamforming Design: Machine Learning-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Wireless communication fundamentals, linear algebra, signal processing, and basic machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Advanced course delivering machine learning applications to real-world communication system design problems for students in their 30s with higher education backgrounds. Combines theory lectures with practical sessions using digital devices (laptops, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operational principles of conventional beamforming techniques (maximum ratio transmission, zero-forcing) in multi-user interference channel environments.
Learners can define input/output variables of DNN structures and mathematically model optimization problems in machine learning-based beamforming design.
Learners can numerically analyze and interpret that the proposed beamforming technique achieves performance approaching 99% compared to conventional optimization methods.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
